english_translation: Narrated by Khuzaymah ibn Jaziy (a companion): I came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: I came to ask you about the creatures of the earth. He said: Ask what you wish. I asked about the lizard (dabb). He said: I do not eat it, nor do I forbid it. I said: I eat what you have not forbidden, so why (do you not eat it)? He said: I found a nation gone and I saw a creation that disturbed me. I asked about the rabbit. He said: I do not eat it, nor do I forbid it. I said: I eat what you have not forbidden, why (do you not eat it)? He said: I was informed that it harms (menstruating women). I asked about the fox. He said: Who eats the fox? I asked about the hyena. He said: Who eats the hyena? I asked about the wolf. He said: The wolf eats something in it good. Abu Abdullah said: He is not corroborated in this.
